section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: This chapter is intended to carry out the provisions of Business Regulation Article, §§2-106.9 and 2-106.10, Annotated Code of Maryland, and Business Occupations and Professions Article, Title 12, Annotated Code of Maryland. In particular, it is intended to set various fees in order to cover the actual documented direct and indirect costs of fulfilling the statutory and regulatory duties of the State Board of Electricians, the State Board of Stationary Engineers, the State Board of Plumbing, and the State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
“Board” means the State Board of Electricians.
“License fee” means the fee paid by an applicant or licensee, as applicable, in connection with the issuance and renewal of a license and the issuance of a limited license and a reciprocal license.
State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors.

The Secretary and the mechanical boards have agreed to average their direct and indirect costs, based on the calculation of costs performed by the Secretary in consultation with the mechanical boards. Based on these calculations, the Board sets the following nonrefundable fees as of January 24, 2024:
Reapplication after expiration of uninsured status — $112.50.
Up to and including 30 days after license expiration — $28;
31 days through 60 days after license expiration — $56; and
61 or more days after license expiration — $112.50.

The Secretary and the mechanical boards have agreed to average their direct and indirect costs, based on the calculation of costs performed by the Secretary in consultation with the mechanical boards. Based on these calculations, the Board sets the following nonrefundable fees as of January 24, 2025:
Reapplication after expiration of uninsured status — $126;
Up to and including 30 days after license expiration — $31.50;
31 days through 60 days after license expiration — $63; and
61 or more days after license expiration — $126.

An applicant for an examination or reexamination shall pay an examination or reexamination fee directly to the testing service chosen by the Board to develop or administer the examination, as such fees are established by the testing service selected by the Board.

section.heading: Deadlines.
section.text: If an individual fails to pass a required license examination, the individual shall wait a period of at least 30 days before retaking the examination.
